- Keep pull requests small and focused on a single concern.

- New features and deprecations must target the feature branch.
- Remove all debugging statements (e.g. var_dump(), dd()) before submitting.
- Do not break backwards compatibility.

Failure to follow these rules may result in your pull request being closed without further action.

### Category

<!-- Choose only one category. -->

-  [ ] **Bug Fix** — Fixes a bug or unexpected behavior.
-  [ ] **New Feature** — Introduces new functionality.
-  [ ] **Enhancement** — Improves or extends existing functionality.
-  [ ] **Refactor** — Restructures code without changing behavior.
-  [ ] **Performance** — Improves speed, memory usage, or efficiency.
-  [ ] **Tests** — Adds or updates tests without changing functionality.
-  [ ] **Documentation** — Adds or updates documentation only.
-  [ ] **Maintenance** — Dependency updates, configuration changes, or other housekeeping.
